text: The University of Michigan Press is part of Michigan Publishing at the University of Michigan Library. It publishes 170 new books each year in the humanities and social sciences. Books from the Press have won many awards, including Lambda Literary Awards, the PEN/Faulkner Award, the Joe A. Callaway Award, and the Nautilus Book Award. The Press has published works by authors who have won the Pulitzer Prize, the National Humanities Medal and the Nobel Prize in Economics. == References == Press Category:University of Michigan campus Category:University presses
title: University of Michigan Press
